intro: Atractylis cancellata subsp. gaditana, commonly known as the Iberian centaury, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
